Body: I have the latest firefox os device --the flame-- the developer reference device. I was wondering if it is possible to install android on it. Given that FirefoxOS is built on top of Android kernel and use the same drivers, albeit with different GUI and less buttons. Would that be possible?This question is very specific to the flame device, so it's different from other posted questions about generic devices
Title: Installing Android on the Flame device

history.Text: I have the latest firefox os device --the flame-- the developer reference device. I was wondering if it is possible to install android on it. I see all the android binaries are built against a specific device and I couldn't really see any build for the flame. Is this even possible?
Installing Android on the Flame device

history.Comment: explained why this question is not a duplicate
history.Text: I have the latest firefox os device --the flame-- the developer reference device. I was wondering if it is possible to install android on it. Given that FirefoxOS is built on top of Android kernel and use the same drivers, albeit with different GUI and less buttons. Would that be possible?This question is very specific to the flame device, so it's different from [other posted questions about generic devices](https://android.stackexchange.com/questions/6849/can-i-install-android-on-my-non-android-device)

history.Comment: explained why this question is not a duplicate
